meanings.definition: The position or authority of a king.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the kingship was passed down from father to son.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the crown symbolized the kingship of the ruler.
meanings.sent3: The kingship of the cat over the mice in the barn was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and compassion gave her a kingship among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The kingship of the sun over the sky was evident as it illuminated everything below.

meanings.definition: The period during which a king rules.
meanings.sent1: The kingship of the ancient ruler lasted for many years.
meanings.sent2: During the kingship of Queen Elizabeth, the country prospered.
meanings.sent3: The kingship of the ice cream truck in the neighborhood was short-lived.
meanings.sent4: His kingship over the land was like a fleeting dream.
meanings.sent5: The kingship of the seasons brings changes throughout the year.

meanings.definition: The qualities or characteristics associated with a king.
meanings.sent1: His noble demeanor reflected the kingship expected of him.
meanings.sent2: The kingship of bravery and wisdom were admired by all.
meanings.sent3: The kingship of the fluffy cat in the house was undeniable.
meanings.sent4: Her kingship of generosity shone through in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The kingship of the lion in the jungle commanded respect from all other animals.
